title: Captain John Smith Chesapeake National Historic Trail: Wildlife Webcams
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Science & Research     Wildlife Webcams              Live Webcams       Thanks to our friends at the Chesapeake Conservancy we are able to see some of the Chesapeake Bay's most notable creatures through these live webcams.  For more information about the Chesapeake Conservancy and their efforts in Bay protection, restoration and conservation go to www.ChesapeakeConservancy.org      Falcon Cam The Peregrine Falcon is a top predator in the avian world. Able to reach speeds of over 180mph in a dive, the falcon uses this to its advantage to stun prey with a quick strike. The falcons you see are are the newest members to the Chesapeake Conservancy's webcam family.        Osprey Cam The Osprey, much like the Blue Crab, is an iconic symbol of the Chesapeake Bay. Also known as the "Fish Hawk" this impressive creature lives and hunts in coastal areas where fish are abundant.
